intro: Caperonia bahiensis f. latior, commonly known as the broad-leaved caperonia, is a flowering plant species native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
